tweets.text:
If you are wondering why a year has passed since the Parkland shooting and Congress has still failed to take action on common-sense gun reform, I suggest you follow the money.

Pro-gun lobbyists spent over $5 million in 2018.

In the year since their friends were killed, the students of Parkland refused to settle for the way things are and marched, organized, and pushed for the way things should be - helping pass meaningful new gun violence laws in states across the country. I'm proud of all of them.

Hey, @realDonaldTrump. 

Maybe no one has told you, but declaring a National Emergency for a wall sets a precedent that future Presidents can declare a National Emergency for:

-healthcare
-climate change
-gun reform

All of which are more pressing and dire than your weird wall.

Hey, @realDonaldTrump. 

Maybe no one has told you, but declaring a National Emergency for a wall sets a precedent that future Presidents can declare a National Emergency for:

-healthcare
-climate change
-gun reform

All of which are more pressing and dire than your weird wall.

Gun violence is an emergency.
Climate change is an emergency.
Our country's opioid epidemic is an emergency.

Donald Trump's ridiculous wall is not an emergency.

This feeling is indescribable, it stills feels like it was yesterday.  I can still hear the gun shots, feel the blood trickle down my body, and see the frozen faces of fear. 
A year later, and I’m thankful for my life and the support of my community but I still miss them dearly. https://t.co/nOaOHGd63k

Since the Parkland shooting one year ago, nearly 1,200 American kids have been killed by guns. This is an epidemic that has got to be stopped.

We must follow the lead of the young activists who have bravely stood up to the NRA, and pass commonsense gun safety legislation.

Last night, I voted to require background checks for all gun sales in the US.

The bill passed and will soon receive a final vote before the House of Representatives.

This is the first time in nearly a decade that we are moving forward on real reform. We are keeping our promise.

tweets.text: In the year since their friends were killed, the students of Parkland refused to settle for the way things are and marched, organized, and pushed for the way things should be - helping pass meaningful new gun violence laws in states across the country. I'm proud of all of them.

✔️Ban assault weapons & bump-stocks
✔️End the gun show loophole
✔️Prevent domestic abusers from legally obtaining guns
